content:
UploadProgressChangedEventHandler Delegate

In this Article

Represents the method that will handle the UploadProgressChanged event of a WebClient.

Syntax

Declaration

public delegate void UploadProgressChangedEventHandler(object sender, UploadProgressChangedEventArgs e);

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • System.Delegate
  • UploadProgressChangedEventHandler

Remarks

When you create a UploadProgressChangedEventHandler delegate, you identify the method that will handle the event. To associate the event with your event handler, add an instance of the delegate to the event. The event handler is called whenever the event occurs, unless you remove the delegate. For more information about event handler delegates, see NIB: Events and Delegates.
